thread.title: Pitino: 'I don't know' about sex parties
thread.title_full: Pitino: 'I don't know' about sex parties

author: TOM MAHON,
title: Pitino: 'I don't know' about sex parties
text:
WILL LOUISVILLE coach Rick Pitino survive the scandal involving his basketball team?
It's a fair question, considering recent allegations that someone at the school hired strippers to have sex with players and recruits.
On Tuesday, ABC's "Good Morning America" aired an interview that escort Katina Powell did with ESPN's "Outside the Lines" in which she said a former Louisville staffer paid her to provide strippers to dance and have sex with recruits on campus.
It was the first interview Powell has granted since her book, "Breaking Cardinal Rules: Basketball and the Escort Queen," was published earlier this month.
 Powell, 42, contends that Andre McGee, who played for the Cardinals before becoming the team's director of men's basketball operations, paid her $10,000 for 22 shows between 2010-14.
McGee is now an assistant at Missouri-Kansas City where he was placed on paid leave Oct. 2 after the allegations surfaced.
Powell said she once asked McGee, "Does Pitino know about this?' And said, 'He's Rick. He knows about everything.' "
On Tuesday, Pitino denied any knowledge of the incidents.
"I don't know if any of this is true or not," he told ESPN's Dana O'Neil, a former Daily News staffer. "There's only one person who knows the truth, and he needs to come out and tell the truth . . . "
According to the book, Powell, her three daughters and others danced for recruits and players. Daughter Lindsay, 24, told "Outside the Lines" she was paid to have sex with former Louisville player Russ Smith, who now plays for the Grizzlies. Daughter Rod Ni, 22, said the same about the Rockets' Montrezl Harrell.
Smith did not respond to a message left by ESPN. Harris told the Houston Chronicle he didn't "know anything about it."
Louisville issued a statement on Tuesday saying that Pitino has no plans to step down.
Stay tuned. Eventually, he might not have a choice.
